revised_title: Post-embryonic Development of the Principal Retina in Jumping Spiders
tldr: The study examines the post-embryonic development of the principal retina in a jumping spider, Plexippus validus. It shows how the tiered principal retina, unique among spiders and arthropods, develops from a simple hemispherical arrangement of primordial receptive segments. The findings provide insights into the evolution of the Salticidae family and the unique visual capabilities of jumping spiders.
